title: ICE: this path should not cause illegal move

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Input:

``` rust
struct T(u8);

fn t() -> *mut T {
    unsafe { 0u8 as *mut T }
}

fn main() {
    let a = unsafe { *t() };
}
```

Output:

```
$ rustc ../test.rs 
../test.rs:9:19: 9:23 error: internal compiler error: this path should not cause illegal move
../test.rs:9    let a = unsafe { *t() };
                                 ^~~~
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', /Users/John/Documents/dev/rust/src/libsyntax/diagnostic.rs:123
```
